Please note that "dl-sotalol" and "azimilide" are medications used to treat certain heart rhythm disorders, but they can also be associated with the risk of inducing early afterdepolarizations (EADs), which are abnormal electrical impulses in the heart. "QT prolongation" is a condition where the QT interval on an electrocardiogram (ECG) is longer than normal, which can increase the risk of arrhythmias.
